TITLE: Web API Authentication Configuration in C#

It accepts two IEnumerable<string> for allowed scopes and allowed app permission values. Requires Microsoft.Identity.Web and Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authorization. The method returns the updated AuthorizationPolicyBuilder for further configuration or endpoint mapping.

TITLE: Configuring Azure AD B2C Authentication in ASP.NET Core
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to set up Azure AD B2C authentication in an ASP.NET Core application. It configures the authentication scheme and options specific to B2C, such as the instance, domain, client ID, and sign-up/sign-in policy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/netstandard2.0/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```

    .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(Configuration.GetSection("AzureAdB2C"));
```

public static MicrosoftIdentityWebAppAuthenticationBuilder AddMultipleDownstreamWebApiSupport(
    this MicrosoftIdentityWebAppAuthenticationBuilder builder)
{

        .AddMicrosoftGraph()
        .AddInMemoryTokenCaches();

    return builder;
}

TITLE: Registering Microsoft Identity Web with Downstream API Options
DESCRIPTION: Extension method that registers Microsoft Identity Web services in an ASP.NET Core application with support for calling downstream APIs. It configures token acquisition and token validation with provided options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/net6.0/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
public static MicrosoftIdentityWebAppAuthenticationBuilder AddMicrosoftIdentityWebAppWithConfiguration(
    this IServiceCollection services,
    IConfiguration configuration,
    string configSectionName = "AzureAd",
    string? openIdConfigurationEndpoint = null)
{
    MicrosoftIdentityWebAppAuthenticationBuilder microsoftIdentityWebAppAuthenticationBuilder =
        services.AddAuthentication(OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
        .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(
            options =>
            {
                if (configuration != null)
                {
                    configuration.GetSection(configSectionName).Bind(options);
                }

                if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(openIdConfigurationEndpoint))
                {
                    options.MetadataAddress = openIdConfigurationEndpoint;
                }
            });

    return microsoftIdentityWebAppAuthenticationBuilder;
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Azure AD Authentication Options in C# using Microsoft Identity Web
DESCRIPTION: This code configures Azure AD authentication options for an ASP.NET Core application. It sets up client credentials, token validation parameters, and claim mapping. The configuration includes options for authority, audience, issuer validation, and custom claim actions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/net462/InternalAPI.Shipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
#nullable enable

using Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication;
using Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.JwtBearer;
using Microsoft.Extensions.Options;
using Microsoft.Identity.Web;
using Microsoft.IdentityModel.Tokens;

namespace Microsoft.Identity.Web;

internal class ConfigureJwtBearerOptions : IConfigureNamedOptions<JwtBearerOptions>
{
    private readonly MicrosoftIdentityOptions _microsoftIdentityOptions;

    public ConfigureJwtBearerOptions(IOptions<MicrosoftIdentityOptions> microsoftIdentityOptions)
    {
        _microsoftIdentityOptions = microsoftIdentityOptions.Value;
    }

    public void Configure(string? name, JwtBearerOptions options)
    {
        if (name != JwtBearerDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
        {
            return;
        }

        Configure(options);
    }

    public void Configure(JwtBearerOptions options)
    {
        if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(_microsoftIdentityOptions.ClientId))
        {
            throw new InvalidOperationException(IDWebErrorMessage.ClientIdIsMissing);
        }

        options.Authority = options.Authority ?? _microsoftIdentityOptions.Authority;
        options.Audience = options.Audience ?? _microsoftIdentityOptions.ClientId;

        // This is an Microsoft identity platform Web API
        options.TokenValidationParameters.ValidateIssuer = options.TokenValidationParameters.ValidateIssuer && _microsoftIdentityOptions.ValidateIssuer;
        options.TokenValidationParameters.IssuerValidator = AadIssuerValidator.GetAadIssuerValidator(options.Authority);

        // B2C doesn't use UseProofOfKeyExchange
        if (!_microsoftIdentityOptions.IsB2C)
        {
            // In the case of a sovereignCloud, the instance is no longer a "well known" authority
            if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(new Uri(options.Authority).AbsolutePath.Trim('/')))
            {
                // For a multi-tenant scenarios
                options.TokenValidationParameters.ConfigurationManager = new ConfigurationManager<OpenIdConnectConfiguration>(
                    $"{options.Authority}.well-known/openid-configuration",
                    new OpenIdConnectConfigurationRetriever(),
                    new HttpDocumentRetriever())
                {
                    AutomaticRefreshInterval = options.TokenValidationParameters.AutomaticRefreshInterval,
                    RefreshInterval = options.TokenValidationParameters.RefreshInterval,
                };
            }
        }

        // If the developer registered an IssuerValidator, don't overwrite it
        if (options.TokenValidationParameters.ValidateIssuer && options.TokenValidationParameters.IssuerValidator == null)
        {
            // If you want to accept multiple issuers, use the AadIssuerValidator
            options.TokenValidationParameters.IssuerValidator = AadIssuerValidator.IssuerValidator;
        }

        // Avoids having to type "Bearer" in Postman
        options.Events = options.Events ?? new JwtBearerEvents();
        options.Events.OnMessageReceived = options.Events.OnMessageReceived ?? (async context =>
        {
            // Potential code to handle x5c claim
            if (context.Request.Query.TryGetValue("token", out var token))
            {
                context.Token = token;
            }
            await Task.CompletedTask.ConfigureAwait(false);
        });

        options.Events.OnTokenValidated = options.Events.OnTokenValidated ?? (async context =>
        {
            await Task.CompletedTask.ConfigureAwait(false);
        });

        // .NET Core 3.1 does not have AddTokenDecryptionKey in TokenValidationParameters
#if NET6_0_OR_GREATER
        // Handling of encrypted tokens
        if (_microsoftIdentityOptions.TokenDecryptionCertificates != null)
        {
            foreach (var certificate in _microsoftIdentityOptions.TokenDecryptionCertificates)
            {
                options.TokenValidationParameters.TokenDecryptionKey = new X509SecurityKey(certificate);
            }
        }
#endif

        if (!_microsoftIdentityOptions.AllowWebApiToBeAuthorizedByACL)
        {
            options.Events.OnTokenValidated = options.Events.OnTokenValidated ?? (async context =>
            {
                if (context.Principal?.Claims != null)
                {
                    context.Principal = ClaimsPrincipalExtension.Merge(context.Principal, context.Principal.GetTenantId(),
                        _microsoftIdentityOptions.SuggestedCacheDuration, AadClaimTypes);
                }
                await Task.CompletedTask.ConfigureAwait(false);
            });
        }

        // Handling of ESTS issued tokens, which are base64 URL encoded, but not padded (like JWTs)
        if (_microsoftIdentityOptions.AllowStandardEstsIssuedTokens)
        {
            options.TokenValidationParameters.Base64UrlEncodedUniqueId = true;
        }

        // Add claim mappings to map Azure AD resource_access, roles, scp, wids claims to Microsoft Identity Web claims
        options.MapInboundClaims = false;
        options.TokenValidationParameters.RoleClaimType = "roles";
        options.ClaimActions.MapAllExcept("aud", "iss", "iat", "nbf", "exp", "aio", "c_hash", "uti", "nonce");
        options.ClaimActions.MapJsonKey(ClaimConstants.Scope, ClaimConstants.Scp);
        options.ClaimActions.MapJsonKey(ClaimConstants.Scp, ClaimConstants.Scp);
        options.ClaimActions.MapJsonKey(ClaimConstants.Roles, ClaimConstants.Roles);
        options.ClaimActions.MapJsonKey(ClaimConstants.Role, ClaimConstants.Roles);
    }
}
```

TITLE: Querying Microsoft Graph with Authentication Scheme using Microsoft.GraphServiceClient - C#
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to specify a particular authentication scheme (using JwtBearerDefaults.AuthenticationScheme) when querying users from the Microsoft Graph API with the Microsoft.GraphServiceClient in an ASP.NET Core application. The dependency on Microsoft.Identity.Web is required to access the authentication methods. The key parameter is the authentication scheme, which determines the policy for token acquisition. Input is via the _graphServiceClient configured for the application; the output is the number of users returned by the query. The authentication scheme must match the expected setup for bearer tokens.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.GraphServiceClient/Readme.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
var messages = await _graphServiceClient.Users
                .Request()
                .WithAuthenticationScheme(JwtBearerDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
                .GetAsync();
int NumberOfUsers = messages.Count;

```

SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.GraphServiceClient/Readme.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
var mailFolders = await _graphServiceClient.Me.MailFolders.GetAsync(r =>
{
    r.Options.WithScopes("Mail.Read")
             .WithAuthenticationScheme(JwtBearerDefaults.AuthenticationScheme);
});
```

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
var mailFolders = await _graphServiceClient.Me.MailFolders.GetAsync(r =>
{
    r.Options.WithAuthenticationOptions(o =>
    {
        o.Scopes = new string[] { "Mail.Read" };
        o.AcquireTokenOptions.AuthenticationOptionsName = JwtBearerDefaults.AuthenticationScheme;
    });
});
```

TITLE: Configuring Microsoft Identity Web Authentication in ASP.NET Core
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure Microsoft Identity Web authentication in an ASP.NET Core application. It sets up authentication services, configures options for Azure AD, and adds token acquisition for Microsoft Graph API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/net462/PublicAPI.Shipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
#nullable enable

using System;
using Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect;
using Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration;
using Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection;
using Microsoft.Identity.Web;

namespace YourNamespace
{
    public static class MicrosoftIdentityWebExtensions
    {
        public static IServiceCollection AddMicrosoftIdentityWebAppAuthentication(
            this IServiceCollection services,
            IConfiguration configuration,
            string configSectionName = "AzureAd",
            string schemeForV1Endpoints = OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme,
            Action<MicrosoftIdentityOptions>? configureMicrosoftIdentityOptions = null,
            Action<OpenIdConnectOptions>? configureOpenIdConnectOptions = null)
        {
            services.AddAuthentication(OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
                .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(options =>
                {
                    configuration.Bind(configSectionName, options);

                    options.SignInScheme = schemeForV1Endpoints;

                    configureMicrosoftIdentityOptions?.Invoke(options);
                }, configureOpenIdConnectOptions)
                .EnableTokenAcquisitionToCallDownstreamApi()
                .AddMicrosoftGraph(configuration.GetSection("MicrosoftGraph"));

            return services;
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Azure AD B2C Options in appsettings.json (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the required Azure AD B2C configuration in the appsettings.json file for an ASP.NET Core web application. Developers must fill in values for Instance, ClientId, Domain, CallbackPath, SignedOutCallbackPath, and SignUpSignInPolicyId relevant to their Azure AD B2C tenant setup. These settings are crucial for enabling authentication and proper redirect behavior during sign-in and sign-out flows. Inputs are provided as string values, and correct replacement of placeholders is required for successful authentication; the structure must adhere to JSON format.

TITLE: Initializing Microsoft Identity Web in ASP.NET Core Program.cs
DESCRIPTION: Example code for program.cs file showing how to initialize Microsoft Identity Web in an ASP.NET Core application. It demonstrates setting up authentication services with Microsoft Identity Web integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/net7.0/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
using Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect;
using Microsoft.Identity.Web;
using Microsoft.Identity.Web.UI;

var builder = WebApplication.CreateBuilder(args);

// Add services to the container.
builder.Services.AddAuthentication(OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
    .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(builder.Configuration.GetSection("AzureAd"));
builder.Services.AddControllersWithViews()
    .AddMicrosoftIdentityUI();

var app = builder.Build();

// Configure the HTTP request pipeline.
if (!app.Environment.IsDevelopment())
{
    app.UseExceptionHandler("/Home/Error");
    // The default HSTS value is 30 days. You may want to change this for production scenarios, see https://aka.ms/aspnetcore-hsts.
    app.UseHsts();
}

app.UseHttpsRedirection();
app.UseStaticFiles();

app.UseRouting();

app.UseAuthentication();
app.UseAuthorization();

app.MapControllerRoute(
    name: "default",
    pattern: "{controller=Home}/{action=Index}/{id?}");

app.Run();
```

TITLE: Registering Microsoft Identity Web with Multiple Downstream APIs
DESCRIPTION: Extension method that adds support for calling multiple downstream APIs to Microsoft Identity Web in an ASP.NET Core application. It configures token acquisition services with user flows from the provided configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/net6.0/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
public static MicrosoftIdentityWebAppAuthenticationBuilder AddMicrosoftIdentityWebAppCallsWebApiWithConfiguration(
    this IServiceCollection services,
    IConfiguration configuration,
    Action<MicrosoftIdentityApplicationOptions>? configureOptions = null,
    string configSectionName = "AzureAd",
    string? openIdConfigurationEndpoint = null)
{
    MicrosoftIdentityWebAppAuthenticationBuilder microsoftIdentityWebAppAuthenticationBuilder =
        services.AddAuthentication(OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
        .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(
            options =>
            {
                if (configuration != null)
                {
                    configuration.GetSection(configSectionName).Bind(options);
                }

                configureOptions?.Invoke(options);

                if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(openIdConfigurationEndpoint))
                {
                    options.MetadataAddress = openIdConfigurationEndpoint;
                }
            })
        .EnableTokenAcquisitionToCallDownstreamApi()
        .AddMicrosoftGraph()
        .AddInMemoryTokenCaches();

    return microsoftIdentityWebAppAuthenticationBuilder;
}
```

TITLE: Configuring OpenID Connect Authentication with OWIN
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure OpenID Connect authentication using OWIN middleware. It sets up the authentication options including client ID, authority, post-logout redirect URI, and notification events for token validation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/net7.0/InternalAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
app.UseOpenIdConnectAuthentication(
    new OpenIdConnectAuthenticationOptions
    {
        ClientId = clientId,
        Authority = authority,
        PostLogoutRedirectUri = postLogoutRedirectUri,
        Notifications = new OpenIdConnectAuthenticationNotifications()
        {
            AuthenticationFailed = context => {
                context.HandleResponse();
                context.Response.Redirect("/Error?message=" + context.Exception.Message);
                return Task.FromResult(0);
            }
        }
    });
```

```
services.Configure<JwtBearerOptions>(JwtBearerDefaults.AuthenticationScheme, options =>
{
    options.TokenValidationParameters.IssuerValidator = AadIssuerValidator.GetIssuerValidator(options.Authority);
    options.TokenValidationParameters.ValidAudiences = GetValidAudiences();
    options.TokenValidationParameters.ValidIssuers = GetValidIssuers();
    options.TokenValidationParameters.SigningKeys = GetSigningKeys(); // Uses <SigningKey>k__BackingField from the options
});
```

TITLE: Configuring Microsoft Identity Web in ASP.NET Core
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure Microsoft Identity Web in the Startup.cs file of an ASP.NET Core application. It sets up authentication services and configures options for Azure AD integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.DownstreamApi/PublicAPI/net8.0/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public void ConfigureServices(IServiceCollection services)
{
    services.AddAuthentication(OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
        .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(Configuration.GetSection("AzureAd"));

    services.AddControllersWithViews(options =>
    {
        var policy = new AuthorizationPolicyBuilder()
            .RequireAuthenticatedUser()
            .Build();
        options.Filters.Add(new AuthorizeFilter(policy));
    });

    services.AddRazorPages()
        .AddMicrosoftIdentityUI();
}
```

TITLE: Acquiring Access Token for Microsoft Graph API in ASP.NET Core
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to acquire an access token for the Microsoft Graph API using the TokenAcquisition service in an ASP.NET Core controller action.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.GraphServiceClient/PublicAPI/net7.0/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public async Task<IActionResult> Index()
{
    string[] scopes = new string[] { "user.read" };
    string accessToken = await _tokenAcquisition.GetAccessTokenForUserAsync(scopes);
    
    // Use the access token to call Microsoft Graph API
    var client = new HttpClient();
    client.DefaultRequestHeaders.Authorization = new AuthenticationHeaderValue("Bearer", accessToken);
    var response = await client.GetAsync("https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/me");
    
    if (response.IsSuccessStatusCode)
    {
        var content = await response.Content.ReadAsStringAsync();
        ViewBag.Profile = content;
    }
    
    return View();
}
```

TITLE: Acquiring Access Tokens for Microsoft Graph API
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to acquire an access token for Microsoft Graph API using Microsoft Identity Web. It demonstrates the use of the ITokenAcquisition interface to obtain a token for a specific scope.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.DownstreamApi/PublicAPI/net8.0/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public class GraphController : Controller
{
    private readonly ITokenAcquisition _tokenAcquisition;
    private readonly GraphServiceClient _graphServiceClient;

    public GraphController(ITokenAcquisition tokenAcquisition, GraphServiceClient graphServiceClient)
    {
        _tokenAcquisition = tokenAcquisition;
        _graphServiceClient = graphServiceClient;
    }

    [AuthorizeForScopes(Scopes = new[] { "user.read" })]
    public async Task<IActionResult> Profile()
    {
        var accessToken = await _tokenAcquisition.GetAccessTokenForUserAsync(new[] { "user.read" });
        // Use the access token to call Microsoft Graph API
        var user = await _graphServiceClient.Me.Request().GetAsync();
        return View(user);
    }
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Azure AD Authentication Options in .NET
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure Azure AD authentication options for a .NET application using Microsoft Identity Web. It shows the setup of client credentials, authority, and various other authentication parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/net462/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
services.AddAuthentication(OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
    .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(options =>
    {
        Configuration.Bind("AzureAd", options);

        options.ClientSecret = Configuration["AzureAd:ClientSecret"];
        options.ClientCertificates = new X509Certificate2Collection
        {
            new X509Certificate2(Configuration["AzureAd:CertificateName"])
        };

        options.Authority = $"{Configuration["AzureAd:Instance"]}{Configuration["AzureAd:TenantId"]}";

        options.TokenValidationParameters.ValidateIssuer = false;

        options.Events.OnTokenValidated = async context =>
        {
            var tokenAcquisition = context.HttpContext.RequestServices
                .GetRequiredService<ITokenAcquisition>();

            var graphClient = new GraphServiceClient(
                new DelegateAuthenticationProvider(async (request) =>
                {
                    var token = await tokenAcquisition
                        .GetAccessTokenForUserAsync(new[] { "User.Read" });
                    request.Headers.Authorization =
                        new AuthenticationHeaderValue("Bearer", token);
                }));

            var user = await graphClient.Me.Request().GetAsync();

            context.Principal.AddUserGraphInfo(user);
        };
    })
```

LANGUAGE: csharp

app.UseCookieAuthentication(new CookieAuthenticationOptions
{
    AuthenticationScheme = "Cookies",
    CookieName = "auth",
    ExpireTimeSpan = TimeSpan.FromDays(1),
    CookiePath = "/",
    CookieSecure = CookieSecureOption.Always,
    CookieSameSite = SameSiteMode.None,
    CookieHttpOnly = true,
    CookieManager = new ChunkingCookieManager(),
    SessionStore = new MemoryCacheTicketStore(),
    SlidingExpiration = true
});

TITLE: Configuring Azure AD B2C Authentication in ASP.NET Core Startup
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure Azure AD B2C authentication in the ConfigureServices method of an ASP.NET Core application's Startup class using Microsoft Identity Web.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.GraphServiceClient/PublicAPI/net472/InternalAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public void ConfigureServices(IServiceCollection services)
{
    services.AddAuthentication(OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
        .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(Configuration.GetSection("AzureAdB2C"));

    services.AddControllersWithViews(options =>
    {
        var policy = new AuthorizationPolicyBuilder()
            .RequireAuthenticatedUser()
            .Build();
        options.Filters.Add(new AuthorizeFilter(policy));
    });
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Token Acquisition in C# ASP.NET Core Controller
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to acquire an access token for a downstream API using Microsoft Identity Web in an ASP.NET Core controller. It uses the ITokenAcquisition interface to obtain the token silently or through a challenge if necessary.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.Diagnostics/PublicAPI/net472/PublicAPI.Shipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public class HomeController : Controller
{
    private readonly ITokenAcquisition _tokenAcquisition;

    public HomeController(ITokenAcquisition tokenAcquisition)
    {
        _tokenAcquisition = tokenAcquisition;
    }

    [Authorize]
    public async Task<IActionResult> Index()
    {
        string[] scopes = { "user.read" };
        string accessToken = await _tokenAcquisition.GetAccessTokenForUserAsync(scopes);

        // Use the access token to call a protected API
        // ...

        return View();
    }
}
```

TITLE: Validating App Permissions with RequireAppPermissions in ASP.NET Core

app.UseAuthentication();

{
    httpContext.VerifyUserHasAnyAcceptedScope("access_as_user");
    return "Hello scope!";
});

app.MapGet("/requireAppPermission", (HttpContext httpContext) =>
{
    httpContext.ValidateAppRole("access_as_app");
    return "Hello app permission!";
});
```

TITLE: Querying Microsoft Graph with Authentication Scheme using Microsoft.Identity.Web.GraphServiceClient - C#
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to use the Microsoft.Identity.Web.GraphServiceClient to specify an authentication scheme when fetching users from the Microsoft Graph API in an ASP.NET Core application. By calling WithAuthenticationScheme on the builder options within the GetAsync method, it configures the request's authentication policy. The approach depends on Microsoft.Identity.Web.GraphServiceClient and expects a properly initialized _graphServiceClient. The count of users is accessed from messages.Value.Count after the asynchronous call. The authentication scheme parameter ensures that the request uses the specified policy for acquiring tokens.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.GraphServiceClient/Readme.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
var messages = await _graphServiceClient.Users
                .GetAsync(b => b.Options.WithAuthenticationScheme(JwtBearerDefaults.AuthenticationScheme) );
int NumberOfUsers = messages.Value.Count;

```

TITLE: Configuring MSAL.NET Options for Azure AD Authentication in .NET
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure MSAL.NET options for Azure AD authentication in a .NET application. It demonstrates setting up client credentials, authority, and token cache options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/net462/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
services.Configure<ConfidentialClientApplicationOptions>(options =>
{
    Configuration.Bind("AzureAd", options);

    options.ClientSecret = Configuration["AzureAd:ClientSecret"];
    options.ClientCertificates = new List<X509Certificate2>
    {
        new X509Certificate2(Configuration["AzureAd:CertificateName"])
    };

    options.Authority = $"{Configuration["AzureAd:Instance"]}{Configuration["AzureAd:TenantId"]}";
});

services.AddMicrosoftIdentityWebAppAuthentication(Configuration, "AzureAd")
    .EnableTokenAcquisitionToCallDownstreamApi()
    .AddMicrosoftGraph(Configuration.GetSection("GraphBeta"))
    .AddInMemoryTokenCaches();
```

TITLE: GitHub Workflow Configuration for Microsoft Identity Web Compliance Testing
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for a GitHub Actions workflow that runs CodeQL analysis on pull requests to validate compliance requirements. The workflow activates on pull requests to specific branches and sets up job environments with various parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.Diagnostics/PublicAPI/net6.0/PublicAPI.Shipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: "CodeQL"

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, dev, microsoft-identity-web-5-0 ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main, dev, microsoft-identity-web-5-0 ]
    paths-ignore:
      - "**/*.md"
      - "**/*.txt"
  schedule:
    - cron: '45 21 * * 5'

jobs:
  analyze:
    name: Analyze
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    strategy:
      fail-fast: false
      matrix:
        language: [ 'csharp' ]
        # CodeQL supports [ 'cpp', 'csharp', 'go', 'java', 'javascript', 'python' ]
        # Learn more:
        # https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/github/finding-security-vulnerabilities-and-errors-in-your-code/configuring-code-scanning#changing-the-languages-that-are-analyzed

    steps:
    - name: Checkout repository
      uses: actions/checkout@v2

    # Initializes the CodeQL tools for scanning.
    - name: Initialize CodeQL
      uses: github/codeql-action/init@v1
      with:
        languages: ${{ matrix.language }}
        # If you wish to specify custom queries, you can do so here or in a config file.
        # By default, queries listed here will override any specified in a config file.
        # Prefix the list here with "+" to use these queries and those in the config file.
        # queries: ./path/to/local/query, your-org/your-repo/queries@main

    # Autobuild attempts to build any compiled languages  (C/C++, C#, or Java).
    # If this step fails, then you should remove it and run the build manually (see below)
    - name: Autobuild
      uses: github/codeql-action/autobuild@v1

    #  Command-line programs to run using the OS shell.
    #  https://git.io/JvXDl

    #  If the Autobuild fails above, remove it and uncomment the following three lines
    #    and modify them (or add more) to build your code if your project
    #    uses a compiled language

    #- run: |
    #   make bootstrap
    #   make release

    - name: Perform CodeQL Analysis
      uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v1
```

TITLE: Configuring Microsoft.Identity.Web with Additional Options
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a more comprehensive configuration of Microsoft.Identity.Web with additional options including token acquisition, claims challenges, and downstream web API integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/net8.0/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public void ConfigureServices(IServiceCollection services)
{
    services.AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(Configuration, "AzureAd", "Bearer")
        .EnableTokenAcquisitionToCallDownstreamApi()
        .AddDownstreamWebApi("DownstreamApi", Configuration.GetSection("DownstreamApi"))
        .AddInMemoryTokenCaches();

    services.AddRazorPages().AddMvcOptions(options =>
    {
        var policy = new AuthorizationPolicyBuilder()
            .RequireAuthenticatedUser()
            .Build();
        options.Filters.Add(new AuthorizeFilter(policy));
    }).AddMicrosoftIdentityUI();
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Authentication in Blazor App.razor
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for App.razor that implements authentication in a Blazor Server application. It shows how to set up the router with authentication and provide fallback content for unauthorized access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.Diagnostics/PublicAPI/net462/InternalAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
<CascadingAuthenticationState>
    <Router AppAssembly="@typeof(Program).Assembly">
        <Found Context="routeData">
            <AuthorizeRouteView RouteData="@routeData" DefaultLayout="@typeof(MainLayout)">
                <NotAuthorized>
                    @if (!context.User.Identity.IsAuthenticated)
                    {
                        <RedirectToLogin />
                    }
                    else
                    {
                        <p>You are not authorized to access this resource.</p>
                    }
                </NotAuthorized>
            </AuthorizeRouteView>
        </Found>
        <NotFound>
            <LayoutView Layout="@typeof(MainLayout)">
                <p>Sorry, there's nothing at this address.</p>
            </LayoutView>
        </NotFound>
    </Router>
</CascadingAuthenticationState>
```

TITLE: Configuring Microsoft Identity Web in ASP.NET Core Startup
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to configure Microsoft Identity Web services in the ConfigureServices method of an ASP.NET Core Startup class. It adds authentication and sets up the OpenIdConnect options for Azure AD integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.Diagnostics/PublicAPI/net472/PublicAPI.Shipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public void ConfigureServices(IServiceCollection services)
{
    services.AddAuthentication(OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
        .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(Configuration.GetSection("AzureAd"));

    services.AddControllersWithViews(options =>
    {
        var policy = new AuthorizationPolicyBuilder()
            .RequireAuthenticatedUser()
            .Build();
        options.Filters.Add(new AuthorizeFilter(policy));
    });
}
```

DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure Azure AD authentication in the ConfigureServices method of an ASP.NET Core application's Startup class using Microsoft Identity Web.

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public void ConfigureServices(IServiceCollection services)
{
    services.AddAuthentication(OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
        .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(Configuration.GetSection("AzureAd"));

    services.AddControllersWithViews(options =>
    {
        var policy = new AuthorizationPolicyBuilder()
            .RequireAuthenticatedUser()
            .Build();
        options.Filters.Add(new AuthorizeFilter(policy));
    });
}
```

TITLE: Acquiring Tokens Using ITokenAcquisition in Blazor
DESCRIPTION: Example of using ITokenAcquisition service to acquire tokens for calling protected APIs. This demonstrates how to inject and use the token acquisition service to obtain access tokens with specific scopes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.Diagnostics/PublicAPI/net462/InternalAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
@using Microsoft.Identity.Web
@inject ITokenAcquisition TokenAcquisition

@code {
    private string _accessToken;
    private string[] scopes = new string[] { "api://MyApi/access_as_user" };

    protected override async Task OnInitializedAsync()
    {
        try
        {
            _accessToken = await TokenAcquisition.GetAccessTokenForUserAsync(scopes);
            // Use the token to call a protected API
        }
        catch (Exception ex)
        {
            // Handle the exception
        }
    }
}
```

```
public class MyApiController : Controller
{
    private readonly ITokenAcquisition _tokenAcquisition;

    public MyApiController(ITokenAcquisition tokenAcquisition)
    {
        _tokenAcquisition = tokenAcquisition;
    }

    [Authorize]
    public async Task<IActionResult> CallApi()
    {
        string[] scopes = new string[] { "api://myapi/access_as_user" };
        string accessToken = await _tokenAcquisition.GetAccessTokenForUserAsync(scopes);

        // Use the access token to call an API
        // ...

        return View();
    }
}
```

TITLE: Main Script Execution for Version Token Expansion in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: The main execution block of the PowerShell script that defines file paths, retrieves the Microsoft Identity Web version, and expands version tokens in the settings file. It handles both project and package versioning.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.Diagnostics/PublicAPI/net472/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
$ErrorActionPreference = "Stop"

$scriptPath = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Path
$repoRoot = (Get-Item $scriptPath).Parent.Parent.FullName
$projectPath = Join-Path $repoRoot "src\Microsoft.Identity.Web\Microsoft.Identity.Web.csproj"
$settingsPath = Join-Path $repoRoot "NuGet.config"
$fallbackVersion = "1.0.0"

$version = Get-MicrosoftIdentityWebVersion -projectPath $projectPath -fallbackVersion $fallbackVersion
Expand-VersionTokens -settingsPath $settingsPath -version $version

Write-Host "Version token expansion complete."
```

TITLE: Expanding Version Tokens in Settings File with PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell snippet replaces version tokens in a settings file with actual version numbers. It reads the file content, performs string replacements for Microsoft Identity Web version tokens, and writes the updated content back to the file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.Diagnostics/PublicAPI/net472/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
function Expand-VersionTokens([string]$settingsPath, [string]$version) {
    if (!(Test-Path $settingsPath)) {
        Write-Error "Settings file '$settingsPath' not found."
        exit 1
    }

    $content = Get-Content -Path $settingsPath -Raw
    $updatedContent = $content -replace '\$\(MicrosoftIdentityWebVersion\)', $version
    $updatedContent = $updatedContent -replace '\$\(MicrosoftIdentityWebSdkVersion\)', $version

    Set-Content -Path $settingsPath -Value $updatedContent -NoNewline
    Write-Host "Updated version tokens in '$settingsPath' to '$version'"
}
```

TITLE: Migrating from Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftGraph 2.x
DESCRIPTION: Code examples showing the differences between Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftGraph 2.x and Microsoft.Identity.Web.GraphServiceClient, including package replacement and code updates.

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
dotnet remove package Microsoft.Identity.Web.MicrosoftGraph
dotnet add package Microsoft.Identity.Web.GraphServiceClient
```

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
// Old code
var user = await _graphServiceClient.Me.Request().GetAsync();

// New code
var user = await _graphServiceClient.Me.GetAsync();
```

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
// Old code
var messages = await _graphServiceClient.Users
                .Request()
                .WithScopes("User.Read.All")
                .GetAsync();
int NumberOfUsers = messages.Count;

// New code
var messages = await _graphServiceClient.Users
                .GetAsync(b => b.Options.WithScopes("User.Read.All"));
int NumberOfUsers = messages.Value.Count;
```

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
// Old code
var messages = await _graphServiceClient.Users
                .Request()
                .WithAppOnly()
                .GetAsync();
int NumberOfUsers = messages.Count;

// New code
var messages = await _graphServiceClient.Users
                .GetAsync(b => b.Options.WithAppOnly() ));
int NumberOfUsers = messages.Value.Count;
```

TITLE: Reading Version from .csproj File in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell script reads the version from a .csproj file using XML parsing. It loads the XML content, retrieves the Version element, and returns its value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.Diagnostics/PublicAPI/net472/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
function Get-MicrosoftIdentityWebVersion([string]$projectPath, [string]$fallbackVersion) {
    if (!(Test-Path $projectPath)) {
        Write-Host "Project path '$projectPath' not found. Using fallback version '$fallbackVersion'"
        return $fallbackVersion
    }

    [xml]$csproj = Get-Content $projectPath
    $version = $csproj.Project.PropertyGroup.Version

    if (!$version) {
        Write-Host "Version not found in project. Using fallback version '$fallbackVersion'"
        return $fallbackVersion
    }

    return $version
}
```

. .\Configure.ps1 -Credential $mycreds
```

TITLE: Configuring JWT Bearer Options for Azure AD in ASP.NET Core
DESCRIPTION: This code configures the JWT bearer options for Azure AD authentication. It sets the authority, audience, and issuer validation, and adds custom claim actions for name and roles.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.Diagnostics/PublicAPI/net8.0/PublicAPI.Shipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: C#
CODE:
```
builder.Services.Configure<JwtBearerOptions>(
    JwtBearerDefaults.AuthenticationScheme, options =>
    {
        options.Authority = $"https://login.microsoftonline.com/{builder.Configuration["AzureAd:TenantId"]}";
        options.Audience = builder.Configuration["AzureAd:ClientId"];
        options.TokenValidationParameters.ValidateIssuer = false;

        options.TokenValidationParameters.IssuerValidator = (issuer, securityToken, validationParameters) => issuer;

        options.ClaimActions.MapJsonKey(ClaimTypes.Name, "name");
        options.ClaimActions.MapJsonKey(ClaimTypes.Role, "roles");
    });
```

DESCRIPTION: This JSON configuration sets up token validation parameters for Microsoft Identity Web. It specifies the issuer, audience, and allowed tenants for validating tokens in a multi-tenant scenario.

{
  "AzureAd": {
    "Instance": "https://login.microsoftonline.com/",
    "TenantId": "common",
    "ClientId": "11111111-1111-1111-11111111111111111",
    "CallbackPath": "/signin-oidc",
    "SignedOutCallbackPath ": "/signout-oidc",

    // To call an API
    "ClientSecret": "secret-from-app-registration",
    "ClientCertificates" : [
    ],

    // If you want to restrict access to Azure AD tenants, update this
    "TokenValidationParameters": {
        "ValidateIssuer": true,
        "ValidIssuers": [
          "https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenantId}/v2.0", 
          "https://sts.windows.net/contoso.com"
        ],

        "ValidateAudience": true,

        ]
    }
  }
}

TITLE: Configuring OWIN Cookie Authentication in .NET Core
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to properly configure OWIN cookie authentication middleware in a .NET Core application. It includes options for setting up the authentication scheme, cookie properties, and token validation parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/net7.0/InternalAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
app.UseCookieAuthentication(new CookieAuthenticationOptions
{
    AuthenticationType = DefaultAuthenticationTypes.ApplicationCookie,
    CookieName = ".AspNet.SharedCookie",
    LoginPath = new PathString("/Account/Login"),
    Provider = new CookieAuthenticationProvider
    {
        OnValidateIdentity =
            SecurityStampValidator.OnValidateIdentity<ApplicationUserManager, ApplicationUser>(
                validateInterval: TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30),
                regenerateIdentity: (manager, user) => user.GenerateUserIdentityAsync(manager))
    }
});
```

TITLE: Configuring Multi-Tenant Azure AD Authentication in ASP.NET Core
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to configure multi-tenant Azure AD authentication in an ASP.NET Core application. It sets up the authentication scheme and adds options for handling multiple tenants, including custom tenant validation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web/PublicAPI/netstandard2.0/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
services.AddAuthentication(OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
    .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(options =>
    {
        Configuration.Bind("AzureAd", options);
        options.Events.OnTokenValidated = async context =>
        {
            string[] validTenantIds = Configuration.GetSection("ValidTenantIds").Get<string[]>();
            string tenantId = context.SecurityToken.Claims.FirstOrDefault(x => x.Type == "tid" || x.Type == "http://schemas.microsoft.com/identity/claims/tenantid")?.Value;

            if (!validTenantIds.Contains(tenantId))
            {
                throw new UnauthorizedAccessException("This tenant is not authorized to access this application.");
            }
        };
    });
```

TITLE: Configuring Azure AD Authentication Services in ASP.NET Core
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure Azure AD authentication services in the Startup.cs file of an ASP.NET Core application. It demonstrates adding Microsoft Identity authentication and configuring options for Azure AD.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-identity-web/blob/master/src/Microsoft.Identity.Web.GraphServiceClient/PublicAPI/net6.0/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public void ConfigureServices(IServiceCollection services)
{
    services.AddAuthentication(OpenIdConnectDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
        .AddMicrosoftIdentityWebApp(Configuration.GetSection("AzureAd"));

    services.AddControllersWithViews(options =>
    {
        var policy = new AuthorizationPolicyBuilder()
            .RequireAuthenticatedUser()
            .Build();
        options.Filters.Add(new AuthorizeFilter(policy));
    });

    services.AddRazorPages()
        .AddMicrosoftIdentityUI();
}
```
